main event: Several bright orange lights or fireballs were observed in the sky in Orlando, Florida on January 7, 1962.
interesting points: The lights moved in a south to north direction at fairly high speed,The observer saw the lights appearing in pairs or groups of 3-5,The lights were round or oval in shape, and very bright orange in color,The observer did not think the lights were flares or aircraft,ATC evaluation suggested the lights might have been burning or chemically-ignited balloons.
witness description: The caller observed the lights moving at high speed for about 5 minutes.
